Got 3 tacos for $10.50. Chose the pollo, chorizo, and carnitas. All the tacos were pretty loaded but the chorizo and carnitas were the best. Chorizo and carnitas were fried into small crunchy pieces and seasoned well. Better than many of the places in the Bay Area.

Cash only! I love this deli restaurant. They have seating indoors and tables outside if you ask. Portions are excellent and flavors are fantastic. I love how they have so many creative combinations for their tortas and burritos, and tons of different meat options. The gorditas are an absolute favorite here and the pozole is soooooo good - it‚Äôll power you through the chilly days for sure. Tacos made with fresh tortillas, and if you order a large drink it‚Äôs literally a quart.

If you‚Äôre into imported sodas and snacks too, they have a lot to choose from. We‚Äôre still working on eating our way through the menu and I‚Äôm having so much fun doing so.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with my wife. The interior is nothing to write home about but the food more than makes up for it in spades.

Healthy portions and authentic food - would definitely come back!

(Cash Only)

Corona Queens is infamous for having so many restaurants ,especially Mexican .

When you walk in this location you realize won‚Äôt be any  fine dining . Place was busy for Sunday afternoon.

Menu could be a little complicated so many choices so many options so I decided to go with the special Barbacoa .

Very delicious huge plates very satisfying I highly recommend . The prices are very reasonable.

The interior of the restaurant very plain just tables chairs refrigerators so just a good place to eat , not really place to take a date to .

M√âXICO üá≤üáΩ
Eat the World NYC review:
The big draw at this Mexican kitchen is a list of 12 tortas locas, designated as crazy by their sheer size. Some versions, like "La Tolte," are heaped with Oaxacan cheese, making it actually physically impossible to eat it purely as a sandwich. Scrape half off before you start, or just let it fall on your plate (or lap) as you eat. One way or another those ingredients will come out. Couples and families fill the place on weekends when it gets busy serving big plates of favorites with rice and beans or bowls of their popular pancita. Don't pass on their weekend-only tamales either. The large refrigerated cases for drinks give away this spot's former life as a working deli, but almost everything else has been removed to make more room for the popular kitchen and tables for customers.
Typical mom and pop shop in Corona, decent food with large portions, reasonable prices. They understand basic English but it's better to communicate in Spanish.
They used to put more love into their cooking. Don Camerino should take into consideration the customers opinions.
